Description: Rim and body sherd (three joining but not mended fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery rosette bowl; pale slip; interior: painted streaky black; exterior: top of lip black; two dot rosettes preserved below, above triple band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 32, pl. 21, no. 1a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.819)
